main.name: Danilo Sambugaro
main.description: I'm Danilo Sambugaro and I'm taking my under degree in Computer Science at Federal University of Technology - Paraná (UTFPR), currently employed by Relevant Solutions where I work as a front-end and back-end developer across the range of our products, as well being one of Embedded Developers in our IoT hardware
main.bio: My first "Hello World" was during high school, around 2012. Since then I have been learning a lot and I'll learn even more, I hope. I'm a big Linux enthusiast, the same for Open Source projects. Being a little bit Maker, I like to play around with Raspberry Pi, Arduino, ESP32 and other microcontrollers for personal projects. Recently I started learning computer vision and neural networks, I'm really enjoying it let's see where this will take me (:
main.contactmessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email if you'd like to get in contact with me.

resume.skillmessage: I believe that everyone always has something to learn and something to teach. Learning is a constant process, I'm always interested in playing around with new technologies

education.description: Here I took my Bachelor of Computer Science and achieved a much more thorough education in the underlying theory, concepts, and science behind more complex programming. I also had hands-on experience, I built database structures for fictional companies, created small video games and also built and coded an Arduino Robot, whose movements were controlled by physical blocks placed on the remote control. I also had a lot of Python and C programming for data structures, also played around with some JS Frameworks, such as Vue and React, and much more.

work.title: Front-end, Back-end and Embedded developer
work.description: Here I work across the range of company's products, working with React js for front-end and Java for back-end, although I'm most active on the company's IoT products, using ESP32 and Raspberry Pi with C, Java and, sometimes, Python.  I also design some PCBs, when it is in range of my skills.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects.

skills.name: C
skills.description: C was the first programming language that I started using in college years ago. Nowadays I use C to program microcontrollers like ATmega328 and ESP32.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: I work with Java daily, constantly improving my skills and knowledge of the language. I haven't work directly with Spring and Hibernate, but I understand how they work.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Python is the programming language that I like the most. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: OpenCV
skills.description: I'm fairly new to OpenCV. I have been working with this library in my undergraduate thesis, seems that I'm getting the hang of it.

skills.name: TensorFlow
skills.description: I'm also fairly new to TensorFlow. I want to use TensorFlow with OpenCV in the future, but first I need to understand it better.
